intro: Anacampseros albidiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, where it forms dense clusters. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
